com.camerontec.catalys.util.stats

Class StoringStatisticalAccumulator

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.camerontec.catalys.util.configuration.AbstractConfigurable
      • com.camerontec.catalys.util.stats.BaseAccumulator
        • com.camerontec.catalys.util.stats.StoringStatisticalAccumulator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IConfigurable, IRegisterable, IAccumulator, IStatisticalAccumulator, IStats, IStoringAccumulator

    public class StoringStatisticalAccumulator
extends BaseAccumulator
implements IStoringAccumulator
    This class is a implementation of IStatisticalAccumulator. It stores the data, print the statistics (average, standard deviation and median) and clears as instructed by dumpEvery parameter.

    Properties:

    • dumpEvery - see BaseAccumulator.setSampleSize(int). Default is 0 (never).
    • windowSize - this class maintains a "rolling window" of data, storing the last windowSize data points and reporting the statistics based on this data.
    • numberOfMessagesIgnoredAtStartup - see BaseAccumulator.setNumIgnoredAtStartup(int). Default is 0.
    • percentiles - see setPercentiles(List). If not specified percentiles will not be printed.

      • StoringStatisticalAccumulator

        public StoringStatisticalAccumulator(int dumpEvery,
                                     int windowSize,
                                     int numIgnoredAtStartup,
                                     String percentilesString)
        Constructor.
        Parameters:
        dumpEvery - Specify the observation interval between dumps of accumulated statistics.
        windowSize - The storage window size in observations.
        numIgnoredAtStartup - The number of initial observations to ignore.
        percentilesString - A list of percentiles to be included in the periodic statistical dump. Specified as a comma separated list of decimal fractions > 0 and ≤ 100.

      • accumulate

        public void accumulate(long id,
                       long val)
        Description copied from interface: IAccumulator
        Accumulates the given data point (id and value).

        This should be very fast and create no objects, so that it has minimal performance impact.

        Specified by:
        accumulate in interface IAccumulator
        Parameters:
        id - ID, if any, associated with the value. Just pass 0 or some other special value if there is no id.
        val - Value to be accumulated.

      • getPercentileValues

        public Percentile[] getPercentileValues()
        Description copied from interface: IStoringAccumulator
        Returns the configured percentile values for all configured percentile, e.g. if this IStatisticalAccumulator were configured to report the 50th percentile, this would return a data structure with 50 as the percentile and the mean for the percentile value.
        Specified by:
        getPercentileValues in interface IStoringAccumulator

        Returns:

      • getAverage

        public long getAverage()
        Description copied from interface: IStats
        Return the current average value.

        This is an optional operation. Concrete implementations may choose whether or not to support based on their specific characteristics.

        Use the IStats.hasAverage() method to determine whether to expect a meaningful return from this method.

        Specified by:
        getAverage in interface IStats
        Returns:
        Average value. If the implementation does not support the concept of average value then this value is undefined.
        See Also:
        IStats.hasAverage()
